intro: Lysimachia × pilophora, commonly known as marsh woundwort, is a flowering plant in the family Primulaceae. It is a hybrid species that typically grows in moist, shady environments such as wetlands and stream banks. The plant features upright stems covered with opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often reddish or purple underneath. Its showy, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in dense cymes and bloom in late spring to early summer. Lysimachia × pilophora is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in wet conditions.
